x.q: How is this distribution different from the original?
t: First of all, what's different about this distribution is the selection of books. The likelihood that a book isn't included here, but is in the "original" giveaways, is minimal. If you find such a book, it's an emergency, please contact me.
Now about the differences.
The main difference is the size. That's what this giveaway is all about.
Additional benefits:
<ul>
• Books with XML structure errors have been repaired.
• Broken illustrations have been repaired or removed.
• Annoying duplicates have been eliminated (not all, of course).
• There are also reader comments from the Flibusta website and brief information about some authors.
• Also, the FLibrary cataloger is being given away here; it's better, better than MyHomeLib.

x.q: Why does the number of books differ?
t: [ul top10]
[*] Duplicates removed
[*] Zero-size files are discarded
[*] Files that were cut off in the middle were thrown out
[*] Added unindexed files, i.e. those that are in the archives but not in the Flibusta/Librusec dumps
[/ul]

x.q: Why then is this distribution so much smaller in size?
t: [p s] The size reduction is achieved as follows:
[ul]
[*] The text of books and illustrations are stored separately.
[*] The texts are compressed in 7z, which is much more efficient than zip.
[*] Images are re-encoded to JPEG XL, which is more efficient than JPEG and PNG.
[*] Reviews and information about the authors are small in size, ~1 GB.
[*] Removed duplicates also provide 5% savings.
[*] Broken and unrepairable images have been removed.
[/ul]
[p s] Bonus: you don't even need to download pictures, reviews, and information about the authors, which will make the files even three times smaller.

x.q: How will the distribution be updated?
t: I will try to update the distribution at the beginning of the month.
[p s] Updates include:
[ul]
[*] A couple of new 7z archives with books in fb2 format, without pictures
[*] 4 new zip archives with images: covers and illustrations
[*] Updating the index file *.inpx
[*] Replacing FLibrary distributions with current ones, if a release has occurred
[*] Update of the latest archive with reader reviews + new (monthly) archive with reader reviews
[*] Update of the latest archive with information about authors + new archive, if enough new entries about authors have accumulated
[/ul]
Thus, each monthly update should affect previously downloaded files as little as possible.

Unfortunately, this approach is not ideal for reader reviews and author information due to regular editing of old entries on the website. Therefore, these files will sometimes be re-uploaded in bulk as edits to old entries accumulate. Or for purely technical reasons.
